name: Grove of the Burnwillows
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Each opponent gains 1 life.

editions.flavor: Spring is the most beautiful season in the grove, when the new leaves open from their ember-buds in a race of leaping flames.
Spring is the most beautiful season in the grove, when the new leaves open from their ember-buds in a race of leaping flames.

name: Grove of the Dreampods
text:
When you planeswalk to Grove of the Dreampods or at the beginning of your upkeep, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card onto the battlefield and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

name: Grove of the Guardian
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{3}{G}{W}, {T}, Tap two untapped creatures you control, Sacrifice Grove of the Guardian: Create an 8/8 green and white Elemental creature token with vigilance.

name: Grove Rumbler
text:
Trample
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, Grove Rumbler gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "The land will not wait for the enemy to arrive."—Nissa Revane

name: Grovetender Druids
text: Rally — Whenever Grovetender Druids or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}. If you do, create a 1/1 green Plant creature token.

editions.flavor: "The seedlings scream for us to loose them upon the Eldrazi, and we shall oblige."

name: Growing Ranks
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, populate. (Create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control.)

editions.flavor:
"We will grow an army large enough to withstand the Izzet's madness."
—Trostani

name: Growth Spasm
text: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library. Create a 0/1 colorless Eldrazi Spawn creature token. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C} to your mana pool."

name: Growth Spurt
text: Roll a six-sided die. Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is equal to the die roll.

editions.flavor:
MORE TO LOVE: Friendly, nature-loving, Bunyonesque SEM seeks SEF looking for a huge commitment.
 . . .  seeks atog prince

name: Grozoth
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Grozoth enters the battlefield, you may search your library for any number of cards that have converted mana cost 9, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{4}: Grozoth loses defender until end of turn.
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

name: Grudge Keeper
text: Whenever players finish voting, each opponent who voted for a choice you didn't vote for loses 2 life.

editions.flavor: "Your defiance is noted."

name: Gruesome Deformity
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has intimidate. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

editions.flavor: She wanted to inspire terror wherever she went. The demons happily granted her wish.

name: Gruesome Discovery
text:
Target player discards two cards.
Morbid — If a creature died this turn, instead that player reveals his or her hand, you choose two cards from it, then that player discards those cards.

name: Gruesome Encore
text: Put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step. If that creature would leave the battlefield, exile it instead of putting it anywhere else.

name: Gruesome Slaughter
text: Until end of turn, colorless creatures you control gain "{T}: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature."

editions.flavor: Though Gideon arrived at Sea Gate too late to prevent the massacre, he still had enough time to lead its survivors to relative safety.
Though Gideon arrived at Sea Gate too late to prevent the massacre, he still had enough time to lead its survivors to relative safety.

name: Gruul Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
• Gain control of all permanents you own.
• Gruul Charm deals 3 damage to each creature with flying.

editions.flavor:
"Not Gruul? Then die!"
—Borborygmos

name: Gruul Cluestone
text:
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.
{R}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Gruul Cluestone: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Forgotten under rocks and vines, Gruul symbols mark the sites of primitive rituals where shamans once chanted to the wild.

name: Gruul Guildgate
text:
Gruul Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Enter and leave the shackles of society behind.
Enter and leave the shackles of society behind.
The scarred rubble around the gate is testament to past meetings of the Clans, summits that inevitably devolved into brawls.

name: Gruul Guildmage
text:
({R/G} can be paid with either {R} or {G}.)
{3}{R}, Sacrifice a land: Gruul Guildmage deals 2 damage to target player.
{3}{G}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

name: Gruul Keyrune
text:
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.
{R}{G}: Gruul Keyrune becomes a 3/2 red and green Beast artifact creature with trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: As perilous and unpredictable as the wilds themselves.

name: Gruul Nodorog
text: {R}: Gruul Nodorog gains menace until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

editions.flavor:
Petting the nodorog
—Gruul expression meaning
"making a really big mistake"

name: Gruul Ragebeast
text: Whenever Gruul Ragebeast or another creature enters the battlefield under your control, that creature fights target creature an opponent controls.

editions.flavor:
"If the other guilds want a war, they should know we've been ready the whole time."
—Ruric Thar, Ghor-Clan chieftain

name: Gruul Scrapper
text: When Gruul Scrapper enters the battlefield, if {R} was spent to cast Gruul Scrapper, it gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The Gruul aren't satisfied with just smashing things. They continue smashing other things with the things they just smashed.

name: Gruul Signet
text: {1}, {T}: Add {R}{G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Gruul territorial markings need not be legible. The blood, snot, and muck used to smear them are unmistakably Gruul.
Gruul territorial markings need not be legible. The blood, snot, and muck used to smear them are unmistakably Gruul.

name: Gruul Turf
text:
Gruul Turf enters the battlefield tapped.
When Gruul Turf enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {R}{G} to your mana pool.

name: Gruul War Chant
text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0 and have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

editions.flavor:
"We are the heart of the wild, the fire in its eyes, and the howl in its throat. Come, join the battle to which you were born."
—Kroshkar, Gruul shaman

"We are the heart of the wild, the fire in its eyes, and the howl in its throat. Come, join the battle to which you were born."
—Kroshkar, Gruul shaman

name: Gruul War Plow
text:
Creatures you control have trample.
{1}{R}{G}: Gruul War Plow becomes a 4/4 Juggernaut artifact creature until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Steering apparatus?! What for? Rip it out, sharpen it, and lash it to the front!"
—Ktank, Gruul plowmaster

name: Gryff's Boon
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has flying.
{3}{W}: Return Gryff's Boon from your graveyard to the battlefield attached to target creature. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

name: Gryff Vanguard
text:
Flying
When Gryff Vanguard enters the battlefield, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Ghouls smashed the door, but I heard the call of the gryffs and knew we were saved."
—Ekka, shopkeeper of Hanweir

"Ghouls smashed the door, but I heard the call of the gryffs and knew we were saved."
—Ekka, shopkeeper of Hanweir

name: Guan Yu's 1,000-Li March
text: Destroy all tapped creatures.

editions.flavor: "He Guan Yu covered the ground on a thousand-li horse;/ With dragon blade he took each pass by force."
"He Guan Yu covered the ground on a thousand-li horse; / With dragon blade he took each pass by force."

name: Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior
text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
When Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may shuffle Guan Yu into your library.

name: Guard Dogs
text: {2}{W}, {T}: Choose a permanent you control. Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn if it shares a color with that permanent.

editions.flavor:
"A good guard is alert. A great guard is also loyal."
—Benalish kennelmaster

name: Guard Duty
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has defender.

editions.flavor: "I was told these were standard issue. Do I look standard to you?"

name: Guard Gomazoa
text:
Defender, flying
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to Guard Gomazoa.

editions.flavor: It lingers near the outposts of the Makindi Trenches, inadvertently granting another layer of defense.

name: Guardian Angel
text: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. Until end of turn, you may pay {1} any time you could cast an instant. If you do, prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to that creature or player this turn.

name: Guardian Automaton
text: When Guardian Automaton dies, you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: The wealthy in the city of Ghirapur outfit their lives with grand machines, entrusting even their children to filigree and gears.

name: Guardian Beast
text: As long as Guardian Beast is untapped, noncreature artifacts you control can't be enchanted, they have indestructible, and other players can't gain control of them. This effect doesn't remove Auras already attached to those artifacts.

name: Guardian Idol
text:
Guardian Idol enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{2}: Guardian Idol becomes a 2/2 Golem artifact creature until end of turn.

name: Guardian Lions
text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

editions.flavor: Approach in peace or not at all.

name: Guardian of Cloverdell
text:
When Guardian of Cloverdell enters the battlefield, create three 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature tokens.
{G}, Sacrifice a Kithkin: You gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: Although they're protective of all creatures, many treefolk are especially fond of the empathic kithkin.

name: Guardian of Pilgrims
text: When Guardian of Pilgrims enters the battlefield, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Immune to the physical warping caused by Emrakul, geists proved to be some of humanity's most important allies.

name: Guardian of Solitude
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target creature gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"It seemed an easy thing, to step into the nothingness, to fall, to die. But then, for an instant, I saw it, eyes filled with endless sorrow, and I turned back to face my pain."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Guardian of Tazeem
text:
Flying
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, tap target creature an opponent controls. If that land is an Island, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

name: Guardian of the Ages
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, if Guardian of the Ages has defender, it loses defender and gains trample.

editions.flavor:
"At my feet, invasions end."
—Statue inscription

name: Guardian of the Gateless
text:
Flying
Guardian of the Gateless can block any number of creatures.
Whenever Guardian of the Gateless blocks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature it's blocking.

name: Guardian of the Great Conduit
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
As long as you control a Nissa planeswalker, Guardian of the Great Conduit gets +2/+0 and has vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)

name: Guardian of the Guildpact
text: Protection from monocolored

editions.flavor: The magic of the Guildpact gives aegis to the spirits pressed into its service. Upon entering the afterlife, they find new focus and are charged with defending the Guildpact against those who would see it broken.

name: Guardian of Vitu-Ghazi
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Vigilance

editions.flavor: It stands sentinel to the great City-Tree, home of the Selesnya Conclave.

name: Guardian Seraph
text:
Flying
If a source an opponent controls would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.

editions.flavor: Her gaze prevents the petty sins and her sword punishes the rest.

name: Guardian Shield-Bearer
text:
Megamorph {3}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Guardian Shield-Bearer is turned face up, put a +1/+1 counter on another target creature you control.

name: Guardian's Magemark
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Creatures you control that are enchanted get +1/+1.

editions.flavor: The soldier moved with fluid poise, his awareness extending far beyond five senses.

name: Guardians of Akrasa
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor:
"Only by the bravery of those who put loyalty above glory is our home kept safe."
—Elspeth Tirel

"Only by the bravery of those who put loyalty above glory is our home kept safe."
—Elspeth

name: Guardians of Meletis
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)

editions.flavor: The histories speak of two feuding rulers whose deaths were celebrated and whose monuments symbolized the end of their wars. In truth they were peaceful lovers, their story lost to the ages.
The histories speak of two feuding rulers whose deaths were celebrated and whose monuments symbolized the end of their wars. In truth they were peaceful lovers, their story lost to the ages.

name: Guardians' Pledge
text: White creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A dozen fighting for each other are worth a thousand fighting for themselves.

name: Guardian Zendikon
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a 2/6 white Wall creature with defender. It's still a land.
When enchanted land dies, return that card to its owner's hand.

name: Gudul Lurker
text:
Gudul Lurker can't be blocked.
Megamorph {U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: The small are mostly ignored by dragons.

name: Guerrilla Tactics
text:
Guerrilla Tactics deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Guerrilla Tactics, Guerrilla Tactics deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

name: Guided Passage
text: Reveal the cards in your library. An opponent chooses from among them a creature card, a land card, and a noncreature, nonland card. You put the chosen cards into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

name: Guided Strike
text:
Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"If you can kill your enemy with the first stroke, you save yourself the labor of the second."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

"May the Ancestor strengthen my hand and guide my blade."
—Nomad war prayer

name: Guiding Spirit
text:
Flying
{T}: If the top card of target player's graveyard is a creature card, put that card on top of that player's library.

editions.flavor:
"Retainer of eternal Sun! Life flash again upon thy wings."
—"Song to the Sun," Femeref song

name: Guild Feud
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent reveals the top three cards of his or her library, may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield, then puts the rest into his or her graveyard. You do the same with the top three cards of your library. If two creatures are put onto the battlefield this way, those creatures fight each other.

name: Guildscorn Ward
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from multicolored.

editions.flavor:
"The Gateless have risen. The Ten shall fall."
—Ninth District graffiti

name: Guile
text:
Guile can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.
If a spell or ability you control would counter a spell, instead exile that spell and you may play that card without paying its mana cost.
When Guile is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Jace vs. Chandra

name: Guiltfeeder
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever Guiltfeeder attacks and isn't blocked, defending player loses 1 life for each card in his or her graveyard.

name: Guilty Conscience
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, Guilty Conscience deals that much damage to that creature.

editions.flavor:
Those who most feel guilt don't need to, while those who most need to feel guilt never do.
—Order proverb

name: Guise of Fire
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/-1 and attacks each turn if able.

editions.flavor:
"Fire will eventually destroy a zombie, but a fiery zombie destroys a lot of other things first."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors

name: Gulf Squid
text: When Gulf Squid enters the battlefield, tap all lands target player controls.

editions.flavor: If it could capture the power it wastes, it would be invincible.

name: Guma
text: Protection from blue

editions.flavor: When the giant returned for the night, he found a dead merfolk on his pillow. Although he praised the little guma, he inwardly wondered where she had hid the head.

name: Gurmag Angler
text: Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)

editions.flavor: If everything in the Gurmag Swamp hungers for human flesh, what bait could be more effective?

name: Gurmag Drowner
text:
Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)
When Gurmag Drowner exploits a creature, look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

name: Gurmag Swiftwing
text: Flying, first strike, haste

editions.flavor:
"Anything a falcon can do, a bat can do in pitch darkness."
—Urdnan the Wanderer

name: Gurzigost
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Gurzigost unless you put two cards from your graveyard on the bottom of your library.
{G}{G}, Discard a card: You may have Gurzigost assign its combat damage this turn as though it weren't blocked.

name: Gus
text: Gus comes into play with one +1/+1 counter on it for each game you have lost to your opponent since you last won a Magic game against him or her.

editions.flavor: "Now I lay me down to sleep — What are you starin' at?"

name: Gush
text:
You may return two Islands you control to their owner's hand rather than pay Gush's mana cost.
Draw two cards.

editions.flavor: Don't trust your secrets to the sea.

text: Whenever Gustcloak Sentinel becomes blocked, you may untap it and remove it from combat.

text:
Flying

name: Gust-Skimmer
text: {U}: Gust-Skimmer gains flying until end of turn.

name: Gutless Ghoul
text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 2 life.

editions.flavor:
"Make sure those wretches feed only upon the plagued. The blood of the healthy is reserved for me alone."
—Garza Zol, plague queen

text: {T}: Target player discards a card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.

text:

{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each +1/+1 counter on Gyre Sage.

text:
You may cast Haakon, Stromgald Scourge from your graveyard, but not from anywhere else.

text:
